alert.note: Alert for Mariposa Madera Foothills (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 28 at 9:56AM PDT until March 29 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: .Flood Watch in effect due to periods of heavy rain in the Sierra Nevada Foothills for locations below the snow line. Heavy rain associated with an Atmospheric River is possible tonight, which may lead to areas of flooding on already saturated soil. Another window for heavy rain may exist Wednesday afternoon with the potential for thunderstorm activity. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following areas, Fresno-Tulare Foothills, Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra, Mariposa Madera Foothills, Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra, South End Sierra Foothills and South End of the Lower Sierra. Areas such as Auberry and North Fork that have already seen flooding in recent weeks could see more throughout this event. * WHEN...From 5 PM PDT this afternoon through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain from an Atmospheric River tonight, and thunderstorms Wednesday afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
